metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7169 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in shadow 4.5. newgidmap (in shadow-utils) is setuid and allows an unprivileged user to be placed in a user namespace where setgroups(2) is permitted. This allows an attacker to remove themselves from a supplementary group, which may allow access to certain filesystem paths if the administrator has used "group blacklisting" (e.g., chmod g-rwx) to restrict access to paths. This flaw effectively reverts a security feature in the kernel (in particular, the /proc/self/setgroups knob) to prevent this sort of privilege escalation.

criterions.comment: shadow: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
